titleStmt.title: In this tretyse that is cleped Gouernayle of helthe what is to be sayd wyth crystis helpe of some thynges that longen to bodily helthe, ...
Governal of health.
titleStmt.author: Joannes, de Burgundia, 14th cent, attributed name. aut
Montagnana, Bartolomeo, fl. 1422-1460, attributed name. aut
Lydgate, John, 1370?-1451? Medicina stomachi. aut

notesStmt.note: The "Governayle of helthe" was originally written in Latin and is attributed both to Joannes de Burgundia and Bartolomeo Montagnana.
Imprint conjectured from and publication date conjectured by STC.
The verses at the end are a version of the John Lydgate's dietary Medicina stomachi,.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
